Figure 1.3: Colgate consumer base
One time buyers
11%		Loyals
21%		Switchers

summary_markdown: This data, sourced from Spaeth & Hess (1989) and presented as Figure 1.3, illustrates the composition of the Colgate consumer base, categorizing customers into three distinct groups: "One time buyers," "Loyals," and "Switchers." The table presents two distinct breakdowns of these consumer segments. In the first instance, "One time buyers" constitute 16% of the base, "Loyals" represent 38%, and "Switchers" make up the largest segment at 46%. A subsequent, potentially contrasting or updated, analysis shows "One time buyers" at 11%, "Loyals" at 21%, and "Switchers" at a significantly higher 68%. This structure highlights a comparative analysis of consumer segmentation within the Colgate customer base, emphasizing the relative proportions of each buyer type across two different data points or analyses.
